name: Durin
desc: The Shadow Dragon and one of Rhinedottir's children.

customize.text: Relationships

customize.name: Rhinedottir
customize.desc: An alchemist, a member of the Hexenzirkel, one of the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, and Albedo's mother. Rhinedottir created an army of shadowy monsters, who attacked Teyvat 500 years ago. She's also known as Gold and R.

customize.text: An alchemist from Khaenri'ah, who created Durin of "Humus."

customize.name: Dvalin
customize.desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

customize.text: An Elemental Dragon, who defeated Durin.

customize.name: Albedo
customize.desc: A genius known as the Kreideprinz, he is the Chief Alchemist and Captain of the Investigation Team of the Knights of Favonius.

customize.name: Rockfond Rifthound
customize.desc:
A beast with monstrous blood that is capable of eroding the boundaries of the world. They were created by "Gold."
They do display certain biological behaviors similar to those of real wolves. Perhaps they feel jealousy towards these their "next of kin," and dream of replacing them someday.

customize.name: Thundercraven Rifthound
customize.desc:
A beast with monstrous blood that is capable of eroding the boundaries of the world. They were created by "Gold."
Once upon a time, they ran riot across the continent, but they went extinct for a time due to resistance and mass hunts. Recently, however, they have re-emerged. The pack of black wolves that now threaten Springvale and Wolvendom are such creatures.

customize.name: Thundercraven Rifthound Whelp
customize.desc:
A beast with monstrous blood that is capable of eroding the boundaries of the world. "Gold" classified them as "Alfisol."
The previous eras, when giant monstrous beasts descended, large swarms of these hounds would go before them to deliquesce the borders of the world and open the way.

customize.name: Rockfond Rifthound Whelp
customize.desc:
A beast with monstrous blood that is capable of eroding the boundaries of the world. "Gold" classified them as "Alfisol."
They follow the encroaching abyss to devour the elements. Fortunately, there are few of them left now in this world.

customize.name: Golden Wolflord
customize.desc:
Hailing from a dark world, this ruler of the black wolves has the power to call upon its followers, its hidden claws, to dissolve space itself and forge a rift through which it may enter.
The Wolflord has no name, for it was but one of "Gold"'s unintentional creations, and that is precisely why it is obsessed with invading worlds that do not belong to it and making a name for itself.
That said, the wolf pack is far from unintelligent. After suffering a defeat in its previous invasion, a deserted island where no humans or protectors dwell has been selected for them to prepare for their lord's descent.

customize.name: Elynas
customize.desc: An Abyssal beast that appeared in Fontaine 500 years ago during the Cataclysm. Elynas is the "Father" of all Melusines.

customize.text: Durin's siblings.
Related Books and Items

customize.name: Skyward Atlas
customize.desc: A cloud atlas symbolizing Dvalin and his former master, the Anemo Archon. It details the winds and clouds of the northern regions and contains the powers of the sky and wind.

customize.name: Skyward Pride
customize.desc: A claymore that symbolizes the pride of Dvalin soaring through the skies. When swung, it emits a deep hum as the full force of Dvalin's command of the sky and the wind is unleashed.

customize.name: Skyward Spine
customize.desc: A polearm that symbolizes Dvalin's firm resolve. The upright shaft of this weapon points towards the heavens, clad in the might of sky and wind.

customize.name: Skyward Blade
customize.desc: The sword of a knight that symbolizes the restored honor of Dvalin. The blessings of the Anemo Archon rest on the fuller of the blade, imbuing the sword with the powers of the sky and the wind.

customize.name: Skyward Harp
customize.desc: A greatbow that symbolizes Dvalin's affiliation with the Anemo Archon. The sound of the bow firing is music to the Anemo Archon's ears. It contains the power of the sky and wind within.

customize.name: Festering Desire
customize.desc: A creepy straight sword that almost seems to yearn for life. It drips with a shriveling venom that could even corrupt a mighty dragon.

customize.name: Dragonspine Spear
customize.desc: A spear created from the fang of a dragon. It is oddly warm to the touch.

customize.name: Strange Tooth
customize.desc: A Dragontooth you picked up in Dragonspine. Perhaps someone would know something more about it...

customize.name: Vitalized Dragontooth
customize.desc: A Dragontooth infused with vitality. Just its luster and texture are enough to make one uneasy...

customize.name: Crimson Agate
customize.desc: A type of crystal formed from the combination of concentrated life force with an energy unique to Dragonspine. Makes for an ideal nutrient for growing Frostbearing Trees.

customize.name: Festering Dragon Marrow
customize.desc:
Specialized refinement material for Festering Desire.
This is the product of purifying Durin's vile venom, which has seeped into and spread throughout Dragonspine's ley lines. By using it on a bloodthirsty sword with a strong affinity for such materials, you can increase that sword's power.

customize.name: Enigmatic Page (V)
customize.desc:
An ancient paper whose contents are completely unintelligible.

Perhaps there's some way to decipher the contents.

customize.name: Chunk of Aerosiderite
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
When Khaenri'ah was destroyed, a great sinner created endless monsters with dark, alien blood flowing through their veins. They rampaged across the land, destroying all in their paths. They were mutated lifeforms, and the mutations were caused by powers from beyond this world. The black serpentine dragon Durin that attacked Mondstadt was one such mutated being.

customize.name: Concealed Unguis
customize.desc:
Body tissue left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
Though they are quite wondrous indeed, these hunting hounds of "Alfisol" are nothing of note before Durin of "Humus."

customize.text: Durin

Millennia ago, there was a kingdom called Sal Vindagnyr. Once upon a time, the priests of the kingdom could touch the heavens and go to the Abyss at the request of the gods of Celestia. On the mountain, a white tree grew, which was part of Irminsul. The High Priest and Priestess of Vindagnyr had a daughter with the gift of foresight. One of her prophecies was the coming of the Black Dragon, who would poison everything with his venom. Then the kingdom was destroyed by the Skyfrost Nail and turned into ruins, and the white tree withered. For many years, no one set foot on these snow-covered peaks until the princess's prophecy began to come true.
The alchemist Rhinedottir, also known as Gold, created many beasts from the Abyss that soon attacked all seven kingdoms of Teyvat. Durin was one of Rhinedottir's children, created in the form of a black serpent-dragon with wings.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Then, my lovely children,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Like rainwater flowing into creeks, and plants growing towards the sun,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Go unto a lovely place, and display your own beauty there with pride."</color>

One day, Durin heard beautiful music and saw the dragon Dvalin. Durin dreamed that he had gone on a long, long journey, into a land where green grass grew and where soulful songs were sung. He dreamed that he sang along with the gentle people of this land and danced in the skies with a dragon as beauteous as a jewel.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Thank you, Mother, thank you."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"You gave me wings to soar and a mighty form."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Mother, I wish to go to a land of lovely songs,"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"I will tell them about you, Mother, and about everyone else."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"I shall tell them that the place where I was born is beautiful."</color>

Durin went to Mondstadt to meet the beautiful dragon, but he did not know that his blood was poisonous and that it would be toxic to people and land. Although he did not mean to cause any harm, he became a real disaster for Mondstadt. The people of Mondstadt believed that he wanted to destroy all living things. The envy of the devilish dragon gave rise to evil that poisoned the land and the people who lived on it. In those terrible days, bloodthirsty monsters and desolation came to Mondstadt. Awoken from his sylvan slumber by the cries of Durin's victims, the Anemo Archon came forth and summoned his faithful servant to his side. For life and for freedom, the Archon and the Wind Dragon rode the wind to face their foe. In a battle that ripped clouds from the skies, Dvalin spread his six blessed wings wide, severing the sky and tearing through Durin's iron scales with the force of a colossal blade. As the conflict plunged the world into darkness, the Wind Dragon struck out with his claws, like swords forged of wind, and they pierced deep into Durin's dark, corrupt flesh. The battle shook the heavens, even the sun quaked with fear. Finally, Dvalin tore out Durin's throat with his teeth, and the evil dragon fell from the sky.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Farewell, Mother! My journey is ended."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"I shall sleep beneath this white, shining silver... and perhaps this, too, is good."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Farewell, O lovely bard! And farewell, O lovely dragon!"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Would that we had met in a different time and place,"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"To meet, to sing and dance together!"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>So he thought most sincerely as he lay dying.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Now then, this great blessing that pulses through my veins,"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"And the lovely sight of the dark universe that gave me birth..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"They are now yours to inherit."</color>

Durin's body fell on the ruins of the ancient kingdom of Sal Vindagnyr, which has since been called the Dragonspine. The snow on the top of the mountains never melts, so the forces of eternal ice were able to contain the poison of decay exuding from Durin's body. His poisoned heart still beats deep in the snow. The blood poisoned the land and gave strength to the monsters living

there. Durin's will to live is capable of resurrecting dead plants and turning them into monsters like the Cryo Regisvine. After the blood of the Black Dragon Durin spilled onto the land of Vindagnyr and the Traveler nourished the dead white tree with Crimson Agates that arose from the blood of the dragon, the long-dead tree at the top of the mountain was reborn again.

After Durin's death, Andersdotter, a witch from the Hexenzirkel, created a version of Durin in a magical world called Simulanka. Although she knew that the real Durin's fate will be connected with Durin of Simulanka, she hoped that one day he will have his own path. Like the real Durin, a dragon of the magical world, destroyed everything he touched, and people feared him. When he wished never to be born at all, a few heroes from Teyvat appeared in Simulanka and saved the dragon. When Andersdotter was creating Durin of Simulanka, her son, another witch, Barbeloth, made a prophecy about Teyvat's Durin: <color=#ffffffd9>"R's child... will one day rise from the dead."</color> <color=#ffffff73>Recent observations at Dragonspine lend credence to this prophecy, and Durin's heart has slowly but surely been growing in vitality. The process is extremely slow, but the trend is clear. Albedo, Durin's brother, hopes that when the time comes, Simulanka's Durin will lend Mondstadt a hand in their hour of need.</color>
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Simulanka
customize.desc:
A long, long time ago, three goddesses created this world and named it "Simulanka."

The Goddess of Creation, who presides over matter and magic, created the mountains and rivers and gave life. Her powers also paved the way for Simulanka to exist in numerous worlds.

After the Goddess of Creation came the Goddess of Prophecy, with dominion over the stars and the course of fate itself. She induced the sky to spin and the earth to move. Even to this day, her statue still stands tall at the highest point of Constellation Metropole.

The final Goddess was the Goddess of Fate, she who reigns over all treasured tales and dearest wishes. She bestowed the fierce and everlasting feelings of love and hate, and showed the meaning of death and hope.

customize.name: Dragonspine
customize.desc: A dangerous, snowy region in the south of Mondstadt where the ice never melts. The land of Dragonspine is saturated with the poisoned blood of the dragon Durin.

customize.name: Hexenzirkel
customize.desc: A secret witch society, which discusses secrets at the tea parties and explores Irminsul. There are eight witches in the Hexenzirkel.

customize.name: Rhinedottir
customize.desc: An alchemist, a member of the Hexenzirkel, one of the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, and Albedo's mother. Rhinedottir created an army of shadowy monsters, who attacked Teyvat 500 years ago. She's also known as Gold and R.

customize.name: Dvalin
customize.desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

customize.name: Barbatos
customize.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.

customize.name: Albedo
customize.desc: A genius known as the Kreideprinz, he is the Chief Alchemist and Captain of the Investigation Team of the Knights of Favonius.

customize.name: Andersdotter
customize.desc: Anya M. Andersdotter was a mortal writer from Mondstadt and a member of the Hexenzirkel.

customize.name: Cryo Regisvine
customize.desc:
A monster formed from a vine that was imbued with the essence of biting frost within the ley lines.
Some studies suggest that plants are like the organs of the world, harmonizing the turbulent elemental energies of the ley lines. Concrete examples of this phenomena are Mist Flowers, Whopperflowers, and the like, which brim over with elemental energy.
In certain circumstances, certain plants will turn into creatures of monstrous size and intent — such as the Cryo Regisvines — in the course of many years.

customize.name: Priest's Box
customize.desc:
A treasure box with a decorative pattern at the bottom. The ornamentation seems to be a part of a three-piece motif. Once the pattern is completed, a certain door may open.
"I thought that the young will grow strong and vital like cypresses."
"But these cypresses are about to wither. Their voices won't be carried by the wind anymore. My expectations towards them, as well as the faith they have in me, will all fall through."
"Once again I'll climb this peak looking for guidance. By the time I'm back down, my daughter will have finished the second painting."
"As long as the third one will be of thawing snow and ice, everything will be fine."

customize.name: Princess's Box
customize.desc:
A treasure box with a decorative pattern at the bottom. The ornamentation seems to be a part of a three-piece motif. Once the pattern is completed, a certain door may open.
"I'm afraid I can't finish the fresco."
"It's been a while since I last saw the blue sky and green grass. I don't know which hues to use to capture the landscape of thawing ice and snow that my father so longs for."
"By the time he comes back, everything will be back to how it was. But I can't take this cold anymore."
"Forgive me, Father. Ukko, I'm sorry you had to see us like this."
"Imunlaukr, I wish I could see you again..."

customize.name: Scribe's Box
customize.desc:
A treasure box with a decorative pattern at the bottom. The ornamentation seems to be a part of a three-piece motif. Once the pattern is completed, a certain door may open.
"I yearn for those frosty skies to stand in flames and burn till there's no living soul in the world."
"I yearn for us to turn to dust carried by the wind so that we can find that outsider who abandoned the princess."
"I yearn for the black dragon from the princess' dreams to engulf the land in a cloud of scarlet poison."
"For I am the last one. There's no need to keep watch any longer."
"I've heard of people who are building a new nation without gods. Perhaps they'll have the power to stand against this world."

customize.text: Chalk Prince and the Dragon

One day, a blacksmith forged a magical sword, onto which he applied the ground claws, fangs, and scales of Durin. The dragon's venom penetrated the sword, giving it special powers. The blacksmith was so proud of his creation that he decided to test the sword himself. As soon as he entered battle, the energy of decay rushed up the hilt and entered his body. Mere mortals could not resist this force. The cursed and insane blacksmith fled in a fit of insanity and may have met his end in an unknown place.

This sword came to Albedo, one of Rhinedottir's children and Durin's brother. Albedo wanted to conduct several experiments, but during his research, he unexpectedly learned the history of the sword. This sword was almost "alive" and was capable of absorbing others' energy. Knowing that ordinary people could not use this sword, Albedo gave it to the Traveler, who had the power to neutralize Durin's poison, so that they would imbue the sword with life force. Albedo then drew this force from the sword, which was found to resonate with him due to their kinship with Durin.

customize.text: Shadows Amidst Snowstorms

When the alchemist Rhinedottir was conducting her experiments to create life with the help of Khemia, one of her experiments failed and was thrown away. It was swallowed by the dragon Durin, and after the dragon was defeated in the eternal ice and snow, the experiment came to life, fed with Durin's blood. The failed experiment became jealous of Albedo, who was almost perfect in its eyes, so it decided to transform into Albedo and take his place. Albedo was able to stop his doppelganger, but its further fate is unknown.

customize.text: Trailers and Story Teasers
Version 1.2 "The Chalk Prince and the Dragon" Trailer

<color=#ffd780>December 11, 2020</color>
This is Dragonspine, an enormous mountain that holds the remains of the venomous dragon, Durin, who fell here after the battle with Dvalin.
Few adventurers dare attempt to conquer this unforgiving environment marked by deep snow, sheer cold, poisonous blood, and monsters. But such things will not dissuade the star-faring Traveler from journeying here...
